# Field Sites

## Towers (Co-)Led by EcoFlux Lab

```{r}
library(leaflet)

# Example coordinates (replace with your own)
site_data <- data.frame(
  site = c("CA-DBB","CA-DB2","CA-DSM", "CA-RBM", "CA-EM1","CA-EM2","CA-EM3","UQAM1","UQAM2","UQAM3","MCGILL1"),
  lat = c(49.1293,49.1190,49.0887,49.1313,
          50.3623,50.3706,50.1738,46.1645,46.5317,46.527972,46.149299),
  lon = c(-122.9849,-122.9951,-122.8954,-123.1964,
          -100.2024,-100.5339,-97.1231,-72.6850,-72.6447,-72.64625,-72.726666)
)

# Create the interactive map
leaflet(data = site_data) %>%
  addProviderTiles(providers$Esri.WorldImagery) %>%  # Satellite-style background
  addMarkers(~lon, ~lat, label = ~site)
```

### CARBONIQUE Sites - UQAM1, UQAM2, UQAM3, MCGILL1

For the location and description of the sites in CARBONIQUE project see the [Field Sites & Data page](https://carbonique.ca/en/data.html). The data collected can be viewed [here](https://288-gic-rshiny.geog.mcgill.ca/knox/carbonique/).

### Burns Bog 1 (CA-DBB)
:::: {.columns}

:::{.column width="65%"}

* [Data Preview Graph](https://ibis.geog.ubc.ca/~micromet/data/burnsbog.html#) (CA-DBB) (2014 - *, Delta, BC, Canada)
* Download Data for [CA-DBB](https://ameriflux.lbl.gov/sites/siteinfo/CA-DBB) from Ameriflux.
* Data from the web plots are available [here](https://ibis.geog.ubc.ca/~micromet/webdata/resources/csv/) 
  * prefix  BB. note that this is raw data – no filtering or QCQA. Database codes are available [here](https://ibis.geog.ubc.ca/~micromet/research/Burns-Bog/Database/BB.html).

### CA-EM1, CA-EM2, CA-EM3
These sites are co-managed with [Dr. Pascal Badiou](https://iwwr.ducks.ca/team/pascal-badiou/) at [Ducks Unlimited Canada](https://www.ducks.ca/). More information on the sites and project are available on the [project website page](https://www.wetlandsolutions.org).

## UBC Climate Station on Totem Field
* Access to [custom data download](http://137.82.254.122/DataExport.aspx) of standard measured meteorological observations (air temperature, humidity, precipitation, soil temperatures, solar irradiance, wind) measured since 1958. Data can be downloaded in .csv format.

## Code and Documentation
Our <a href="https://github.com/CANFLUX">lab organization</a> hosts code for flux processing, README docs for our lab, and various other bits of information. Details on our data processing pipeline are available on our [Pipeline Documentation page](https://ecoflux-lab.github.io/PipelineDocumentation/PipelineDocumentation.html)

More documentation related to maintenance procedures for our sites can be found <a href="https://ubc-micromet.github.io/Documentation.html">here</a>.
